meanings.definition: To watch over and direct (an undertaking or group of people)
meanings.sent1: The teacher will oversee the students during the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The manager will oversee the construction project to ensure it is completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to oversee the dog's attempt at catching a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: As the captain, he must oversee the ship through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The security guard will oversee the entrance to prevent unauthorized access.

meanings.definition: To supervise or manage (a project or activity)
meanings.sent1: The principal will oversee the school play rehearsals.
meanings.sent2: She was chosen to oversee the fundraising event for the charity.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to oversee the assembly line production.
meanings.sent4: The queen must oversee the kingdom's affairs with wisdom and care.
meanings.sent5: The chef will oversee the preparation of the banquet to ensure it is perfect.
